comment.author: 35128489@N07
comment._content:
I wish I could read what the badge says. I do remember him though - he trained me to catalogue when I arrived in the Library in 1979. This was in the days before computers.
(Added on behalf of Barbara Humphries)

comment.author: 35128489@N07
comment._content:
I think the badge looks to me like an AUT (precursor to UCU) one which said
"[something something] our Universities" Some of us in the 1980s had to march behind AUT banners which read:
"Rectify the anomoly".
I do wonder what Walter Hughes was like as a library user if he had already been a cataloguer, exacting I guess.
Pin stripe suit not often visible on a cataloguer these days.
(added on behalf of Liz Chapman)
